qas.question: When did California's largest wildfire of the century take place?
How many acres were burned in the historic Cedar Fire of 2003?
Why did San Diego schools close during the Cedar Fire?
How many years after the Cedar Fire did additional fires destroy Rancho Santa Fe?
How many homes were destroyed in the Cedar Fire?
When did California's smallest wildfire of the century take place?
How many acres were burned in the historic Cedar Fire of 2002?
Why did San Francisco schools close during the Cedar Fire?
How many years after the Cedar Fire did additional fires destroy Rancho Francisco Fe?
How many homes were saved in the Cedar Fire?

context: San Diego and its backcountry are subject to periodic wildfires. In <a0_0><b5_0>October 2003<b5_0/><a0_0/>, San Diego was the site of the Cedar Fire, which has been called the largest wildfire in California over the past century. The fire burned <a1_0><b6_0>280,000 acres<b6_0/> (1,100 km2)<a1_0/>, killed 15 people, and destroyed <a4_0><b9_0>more than 2,200<b9_0/><a4_0/> homes. In addition to damage caused by the fire, smoke resulted in a significant increase in emergency room visits due to asthma, respiratory problems, eye irritation, and smoke inhalation; the <a2_0><b7_0>poor air quality<b7_0/><a2_0/> caused San Diego County schools to close for a week. Wildfires <a3_0><b8_0>four years later<b8_0/><a3_0/> destroyed some areas, particularly within the communities of Rancho Bernardo, Rancho Santa Fe, and Ramona.
